security_audit.summary: Prompt-only skill containing AI instructions for document analysis. No executable code, no direct filesystem access, no network calls. External scripts referenced but not included. Pure instruction-based workflow for legal document processing.

content.value_statement: Manually review legal documents to identify forced surrenders, threats, and procedural irregularities. Generate structured JSON analysis with verbatim evidence extraction and forensic conclusions for court audit trails.
actual_capabilities: Read and analyze JSON task files containing historical legal documents
Identify coerced surrenders, threats, and lack of informed consent
Extract verbatim quotes with page numbers and provenance
Generate structured JSON analysis with metadata validation
Flag corrupt files or OCR failures for further processing
Follow legal-grade verbatim and citation protocols
limitations: Requires external refinement_workflow.py script to function
Cannot directly read PDF or image files
Manual analysis only - no automated keyword scanning
Submit task must be approved by manager before finalization

use_cases.title: Historical Coercion Research
use_cases.description: Review McKenna-McBride Commission documents for evidence of forced surrenders and missing interpreters.

use_cases.title: Court Audit Trail Creation
use_cases.description: Generate auditable JSON analysis with strict provenance checks for legal proceedings.

use_cases.title: Document Validation Pipeline
use_cases.description: Process batches of incoming documents and flag those with provenance failures or OCR issues.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Document Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Process this Coercion_Duress batch. Get the task, read the JSON input, and analyze each document for language of threat, signatures obtained under duress, or lack of translation services. Output structured analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Context-Aware Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this Super Task block as continuous narrative. Look for phrases like 'advised to sign', 'better for them', or 'inevitable'. Note procedural irregularities like unwitnessed X marks.

prompt_templates.title: Forensic Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create JSON output with exact quotes, page numbers, and provenance. Use controlled vocabulary for reliability and OCR status. Ensure summary exceeds 100 characters with factual context.

prompt_templates.title: Exception Handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Review task for metadata integrity. If doc_id or date missing, find it in content. If text is garbled, flag with 'OCR_Failure'. If provenance is Unknown, flag with 'Provenance_Failure'.

output_examples.input: Process this Coercion_Duress batch about a 1913 letter regarding IR10 acreage reduction.

best_practices: Re-read instructions after every 5 tasks to prevent context drift
Use exact verbatim quotes rather than paraphrasing
Populate all required metadata fields with factual content only
Check for implicit pressure phrases beyond keyword matching
anti_patterns: Using 'likely' or 'suggests' instead of factual language
Returning 'Unknown' for metadata that exists in the document
Writing scripts to auto-scan instead of manual analysis

faq.question: What is the Coercion_Duress queue?
faq.answer: A specialized pipeline for processing documents related to forced surrenders, threats, and lack of informed consent in historical legal records.

faq.question: What file formats does this skill process?
faq.answer: The skill processes JSON task files. Underlying source documents are PDF or image formats handled by external pipeline scripts.

faq.question: Can I use keyword matching for analysis?
faq.answer: No. The protocol requires manual reading and semantic judgment. Keyword-only approaches are explicitly forbidden.

faq.question: Is data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill operates only on JSON metadata. All file I/O is handled by external workflow scripts with no network access.

faq.question: Why was my submission rejected?
faq.answer: Common causes: using opinion words, summary under 100 characters, missing required fields, or invalid date format (use YYYY or Undated).

faq.question: How does this differ from other document clerks?
faq.answer: This clerk enforces legal-grade protocols: strict provenance checks, contradiction logging, and mandatory verbatim extraction with page anchoring.
